name: Migas
short_description: Originating from Iberian traditions, this rustic appetizer features softened bread sautéed in rich lard and olive oil, infused with aromatic garlic. Each bite delivers a comforting crunch and savory depth.

name: Pastel de nata
short_description: Deliciously flaky and creamy, these Portuguese egg custard tarts feature a delicate balance of sweet and spicy cinnamon. Baked to perfection, they offer a taste of Portugal’s rich culinary heritage.

name: Francesinha
short_description: Originating from Porto, this indulgent sandwich layers tender beef, juicy pork, and savory sausages between toasted bread, all smothered in a rich, beer-infused sauce and melted cheese. A true comfort food delight!

name: Feijoada à portuguesa
short_description: A rich Portuguese stew, feijoada à portuguesa combines tender white and kidney beans with savory blood sausage, farinheira, and succulent pork. This hearty dish celebrates Portugal's culinary heritage, offering a comforting blend of flavors in every bite.

name: Espetada
short_description: Originating from Madeira, succulent beef marinated in garlic and salt is skewered on fragrant bay leaf sticks, creating a smoky, herb-infused delight grilled to perfection.

name: Bacalhau
short_description: Dried and salted cod takes center stage in Portugal's culinary heritage, celebrated in over a thousand recipes. Savory, tender, and often paired with potatoes or olives, it delights with every bite.

name: Arroz de pato
short_description: Savor the essence of Portugal with this hearty rice dish, where tender duck and smoky chorizo are simmered to perfection. Infused with aromatic bay leaves and garlic, each bite offers a comforting taste of tradition.

name: Bacalhau com natas
short_description: Savory salted cod meets creamy decadence in this beloved Portuguese classic. Layers of tender cod, crispy potatoes, and rich cream create a comforting dish that's perfect for sharing.

name: Açorda
short_description: Delights with its rich blend of pounded herbs, garlic, and olive oil, creating a comforting, thick bread soup. A beloved staple in Portuguese cuisine, it's often topped with poached eggs for added richness.

name: Arroz de marisco
short_description: Originating from Portugal's coastal regions, this vibrant seafood rice dish bursts with the briny flavors of squid, clams, shrimp, and mussels. Cooked to a creamy perfection, it offers a taste of the ocean in every bite.

name: Caldo verde
short_description: Originating from Portugal, this comforting soup blends creamy potatoes and tender collard greens, drizzled with rich olive oil and infused with aromatic garlic and onion, creating a warm, hearty dish enjoyed by families and gourmet chefs alike.

name: Cozido
short_description: A hearty Portuguese stew, cozido features an array of meats and seasonal vegetables, simmered to perfection. Each region offers its own twist, making it a beloved comfort food steeped in tradition.

name: Rojões
short_description: A beloved dish from northern Portugal, Rojões features tender marinated pork simmered in white wine, garlic, and aromatic bay leaves. Rich cumin adds depth to this hearty, rustic stew.

name: Arroz doce
short_description: Originating in Portugal, this creamy rice pudding blends tender rice with rich milk, sugar, and a hint of cinnamon. Each spoonful is a comforting embrace of sweet nostalgia and tradition.

name: Bolinhos de bacalhau
short_description: Crispy on the outside and fluffy within, these beloved cod fritters blend tender potatoes, aromatic garlic, and savory onion. A must-try taste of Portugal’s culinary heritage!
most_iconic_place: Casa Portuguesa do Pastel de Bacalhau

name: Alheira
short_description: Smoky and savory, alheira showcases Portugal's rich culinary heritage with a blend of meats, garlic, and paprika, all encased in crisp, golden-brown sausage. Perfectly grilled, it’s a must-try delicacy!

name: Bacalhau à brás
short_description: A beloved Portuguese classic, tender shredded salt cod mingles with golden fried potato strips, caramelized onions, and creamy eggs, all crowned with briny olives for a delightful savory experience.

name: Frango assado com piri piri
short_description: Roasted to perfection, this Portuguese favorite features a butterflied chicken marinated in a zesty blend of piri piri, garlic, and thyme, delivering a spicy kick and irresistible flavor. Enjoy a taste of tradition!

name: Dobrada
short_description: Originating from Portugal, this hearty dish features tender veal tripe simmered with robust beans, sweet carrots, and aromatic garlic. A comforting blend of flavors, it embodies home-cooked tradition.

name: Leite de creme
short_description: Originating from Portugal, this velvety egg custard delights with a creamy blend of milk, sugar, and a hint of cinnamon. Silky smooth and subtly spiced, it’s a comforting classic enjoyed by many.

name: Broa
short_description: Originating from Portugal, this rustic corn bread features a hearty blend of yellow cornmeal, wheat, and rye flour. Its thick, crusty exterior gives way to a moist, tender interior, perfect for pairing with soups or stews.

name: Bolo de arroz
short_description: A beloved treat in Portuguese bakeries, these light rice cakes delight with their mild sweetness and zesty lemon notes. Perfectly fluffy, they make for a charming afternoon snack or dessert.

name: Pastel de Belém
short_description: Originating from Lisbon, these delicate egg custard tarts boast a flaky pastry shell filled with a rich blend of milk, eggs, and lemon, offering a perfect balance of creamy sweetness and zesty brightness.

name: Canja de galinha
short_description: A beloved Portuguese classic, this comforting chicken soup features tender chicken simmered in a flavorful broth with sautéed onions, rice, and orzo. Each spoonful warms the soul, reflecting regional traditions and home-cooked love.

name: Bitoque
short_description: A beloved Portuguese classic, Bitoque features a juicy fried steak topped with a sunny-side-up egg, served alongside crispy fries and vibrant salads. Savory and satisfying, it's a must-try for meat lovers.

name: Carne de porco à Alentejana
short_description: Marinated pork mingles with tender clams in a savory, wine-infused sauce, accented by peppers and crispy potatoes. A cherished dish from Portugal, it captures the coastal flavors of Alentejo.

name: Amêijoas à Bulhão Pato
short_description: Originating from Portugal, this dish celebrates the coastal bounty with tender clams sautéed in fragrant olive oil, zesty lemon juice, and aromatic garlic, finished with fresh coriander for a vibrant kick.

name: Bolo rei
short_description: A festive round cake hailing from Portugal, Bolo Rei bursts with flavors of candied fruits, nuts, and spices. Traditionally enjoyed during the Christmas season, it symbolizes abundance and celebration.

name: Bifana
short_description: A beloved staple of Portuguese street food, this sandwich features tender, marinated pork steaks simmered in garlic and spices, served in a crusty roll. Each bite bursts with savory flavor and tradition.

name: Prego
short_description: Savor the vibrant flavors of Portugal with a Prego sandwich, featuring tender, garlic-seasoned beef sautéed with onions and wine, all nestled in a soft roll. A perfect blend of spice from mustard and hot sauce makes every bite unforgettable.

name: Polvo à Lagareiro
short_description: Tender octopus is grilled to perfection, then drizzled with fragrant olive oil and tossed with garlic, parsley, and crispy potatoes. A beloved Portuguese favorite that celebrates coastal flavors.

name: Rabanada
short_description: Originating from Portugal, this sweet delight features thick slices of stale bread soaked in a rich milk and egg mixture, then deep-fried to golden perfection. Dust it with sugar and cinnamon for a comforting finish.

name: Tempura
short_description: Battered and deep-fried to perfection, tempura showcases Portugal’s culinary finesse. Delicate, crispy textures enhance the fresh flavors of seasonal vegetables and seafood, celebrating simplicity in every bite.

name: Caldeirada
short_description: Originating from Portugal’s coastal towns, this hearty seafood stew blends tender squid, octopus, and shellfish with sautéed onions and a splash of white wine, creating a symphony of ocean flavors.

name: Cataplana
short_description: Originating from the Algarve, cataplana bursts with the flavors of fresh shrimp, succulent lobster, and briny clams, all simmered in olive oil for a rich, communal seafood feast. Enjoy the vibrant taste of Portugal in every bite!

name: Arroz de bacalhau
short_description: Savor the essence of Portugal with Arroz de bacalhau, a comforting blend of tender salt cod, fragrant rice, and sautéed onions, all enriched with garlic and olive oil. Each bite offers a harmonious balance of flavors that reflects the country’s rich maritime heritage.
